title: General introduction to the Tyrosafe project
segmentation: OK, good afternoon everyone.
Glad you've stayed on from all your other activities and you're joining us here for the Tyro Safe Workshop then.
For those of you don't know, my name is Steve Phillips and I'm with Phil, which is the logo on the bottom right hand side.
We were the one of the one of the supporters.
If you like of this project and will be seeing it all the way through to ensure that you know it has a good link with.
Of the other activities I stand in front of there OK?
I'm not getting self conscious with the fact that it's been video, just got nothing to do with it.
OK, so the tyro safe workshop.
Which you've joined us here today and I'm glad to see that so many of you are here.

If I can move really on the objectives of this workshop, Ann Damaris here will tell you more about the overall project yourself, but this immediate workshop is the first workshop in the in the project, 'cause it's a fairly new project funded by the European Commission objectives, are to look at the definition of the needs and benefits of different policies relating to skilling.
Distance to let me just remind myself skidding resistance rolling resistance.
Anta noise on Rd.
So deal with it in a very holistic manner and looking at the interaction between the different policies to look at.
As I say, how different policies took some serve the same purpose.
So what do we do with tires?
What do we do with Rd surface is what do we do with skin existence and how might you know the the the issues we have with one characteristic?
How they might influence those on another?
And maybe we can find ways of achieving the same end through the back door as it were.
This is a European project and I mean I'm glad there's as a very international audience here.
But it is a European project and one of the immediate aims is to find the gaps in the policies and regulations that exist throughout Europe, but also find where we have the overlaps.
So it's not just the gaps but also the overlaps throughout Europe where they are they different in one country in another?
Again, how have people approached it in a different way and how can we overcome those differences?
And ultimately, and this is, I think, the aim for all of us is to find the benefits and needs that we could have for future.
Harmonize EU policies in this whole area.
You know, tire Rd interaction?

How do we improve the environmental, societal and all of the other aspects that we want to achieve in the future, both with our tire industry colleagues with the road engineers with the highway agencies, etc etc.
So without further ado, I want to hand over to Damaris and I encourage you all to be very, very active.
I was only half joking when I talked about the electric being attached to the seat.
So you know, we do want a massive contribution for y'all this afternoon.
Partly because I've been asked to sum up at the end of the day.
And if you don't say anything, I'm going to be totally silent.
OK, demaris.
Thank you very much, Steve.
Thank you very much for this introduction.
I'm I'm very happy to have her here as well, represented by Steve Phillips today.
And yes, here you can see what are.
Going to do today.
First of all, I would just give you a short introduction into the project so they don't know what it is, what it is about and justice cope.
Then we will have warmer presentation on policies for skid resistance followed by a discussion on it.
Of course, these pointing that gender will be led by Roland Spillover, who is work package leader in the project of the work package on policies and by Peter Rowe from TRL.
Then we will have a short break and afterwards we are planning to talk about policies for noise emissions and rolling resistance.

This is going to be done by Fabian Anfuso from LCC and cannot fiber from past and also the discussion will be led by Fabian on Fossil who are our experts here for the Noise emission center rolling resistance policies.

Then we will have a break again and after the second break we're going to talk about harmonization of measurements which will be led by Mint and tool from LCC and the moderation of the discussion will be done by Peter.
Oh again.
And afterwards Steve will be welcomed to tell us something about the conclusions.
So maybe just a short introduction on that I receive project.
It is called the Tire and Rd service optimization for skid resistance and further effects, which are noise emissions and rolling resistance.
So what is it?
It's an U project.
We had a proposal in Framework Program 7 and it's a coordinated action you can see here the partners which are from 7 European countries.
And the project has a duration of two years and we started on 1st of July.
So what's the background?
Why did you decide to do a coordinate coordination action on these issues?
All of you know that interaction between tire and the road has several effects.
One of the most important escape resistance, which is important in order to provide the necessary safety for your right.
But then you have also some kind of negative impacts resulting out of this interaction which are rolling resistance that leads to higher.
Consumption of energy and noise emissions.
Those issues need to be researched and they need to be brought together in a way that the optimization of the tire and the road surface doesn't affect in a negative way, one or the other.
So then there is Europe and all over Europe.
There are different policies for measuring these issues.
There are different methods and there are also different parameters applied in order to get a picture of how those effects are on European roads.
And then there are also the interdependencies between those three issues that has to be researched on, so there has already been quite a lot of attempts in the in the last 15 years.

I think in order to bring those research together and there has for example being that the pie experiment order has been default homeless project where which most of you will already know, but the results were quite good, but there was no common approach.
That already solved those issues.
So therefore, for our project we have the concept to identify best practices, what has already been done.
We would like to bring all those things together.
We want to share the knowledge that is existing all over Europe and we want to raise awareness for those three issues.

And we want to go forward towards harmonized approach, which could then lead in a in a later in a later stage to the development of new solutions and technologies that is out of scope of this project.
But we would like to derive certain recommendations for few.
Ouch.
So here we can see these are the main objectives of our project.
We are trying to get those objectives.
We're trying to reach those objectives by organizing such workshops or expert meetings by getting your inputs.
That's very important for us that you participate in that you share your knowledge and your experiences with us so that we can go towards this objectives.
We are going to do certain research.
Studies were going literature.
Going to do literacy, literature, study or studies and policies and so on.
And we will.
We will try to bring all the existing knowledge together on a basis so that we can go forward to increase Rd safety and also to support the Greening of European.
Transport.
So this should be the impact that we would like to achieve with at the end of our project.

We would like to make recommendations for common European policies concerning those three effects that should lead to an improvement of Rd safety that could happen by reduction of accidents due to safer or more compareable roads.

Safer roads would also allow for increased mobility and we would maybe get a comperable rude behavior on European roads and also the Greening of Rd surface trends, but would be supported by reducing CO2 production and in that way energy consumption and pirate using noise emissions.
So that's basically what I wanted to tell you about the project.
You can also find us our project in the Internet.
I'm not sure.
OK, I haven't put it on.
I'm sure we will hand over this to you as well.
And yes, if you have any questions, you're free to ask.
I don't know or either touring all our discussions or during the coffee break.
Yes please.
The CO2 production and the environmental cost of changes in the road surface materials.
The environmental costs.
May I hand over to my colleague?
Peter oh, answering this question to you because he's our expert on on these issues.
I didn't know I was next on the issues that particular topic John will be covered under work package for within the project.
So there's a specific component of the project to look at.
The environmental implications which include the things that you've been mentioning.
OK, thank you very much, Peter.
So then I would like to hand over to Orange peel over who would start.
